Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2009 04:38PM stacyj4 wrote: Hey everybody, this is my first time on, I have been reading your discussions for a while and have decided to pose to all of you my predicament.  I had a double mastectomy with reconstruction with latissimus flap on January 29th, all went well and began chemo on March 29th.  After being there for 5 hours the nurse asked me if my breast was always that swollen.  The answer was no.  She was worried that my port was leaking.  I had a herceptin treatment a week later and two hours after the treatment the same thing happened.  Today I had a port study and there is no leaking, however, two hours after that guess what, my left boob is swollen, filled with fluid????ANYONE, it is a little nerve racking, so any help is appreciated.
Posts.Title: **NEW** Starting Chemo March 2009 ginagina celia088

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2009 04:51PM stacyj4 wrote: Lisa I love your look and the plastic surgeon says everything is ok, but nobody can tell me wtf is going on.
Posts.Title: **NEW** Starting Chemo March 2009 ginagina celia088

Posts.Content: stacyj4 wrote: Hey anyone, I am looking for answers or better yet reassurance....  I had a double mastectomy with the latissumas flap reconstruction all at the same time.  I am now have chemo every 3 weeks and Herceptin every week.  I had a port put in in March.  Every time fluid is put through the port I end up retaining fluid in my breast.  I had the port checked for leaks--No leaks and have been to 4 doctors who all reassure me that it is ok, but can't tell me what is going on.  I hate the thought of chemo leaking into my soft tissue, but I would guess that I would actually feel that.  Anybody have a similar experience that my ease my mind or worry me if you have to. Thanks Stacy Dx 1/4/2009, IDC, 2cm, Stage II, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Fluid Build Up During Chemo HELP stacyj4 enjoylife
